content:
The Bulletin of the AMS is preparing a special issue devoted to proof assistants and automation of mathematics. Some of the papers are already available

  • Alejandro Adem, A note from the chief editor, DOI:10.1090/bull/1837
  • Jeremy Avigad, Mathematics and the formal turn, DOI:10.1090/bull/1832
  • Kevin Buzzard, Mathematical reasoning and the computer, DOI:10.1090/bull/1833
  • Johan Commelin and Adam Topaz, Abstraction boundaries and spec driven development in pure mathematics, DOI:10.1090/bull/1831
  • Ernest Davis, Mathematics, word problems, common sense, and artificial intelligence, DOI:10.1090/bull/1828
  • Andrew Granville, Proof in the time of machines, DOI:10.1090/bull/1826
  • Michael Harris , Automation compels mathematicians to reflect on our values, DOI:10.1090/bull/1825
  • Michael Shulman, Strange new universes: Proof assistants and synthetic foundations, DOI:10.1090/bull/1830
  • Akshay Venkatesh, Some thoughts on automation and mathematical research, DOI:10.1090/bull/1834
  • Geordie Williamson, Is deep learning a useful tool for the pure mathematician?, DOI:10.1090/bull/1829
